description:
'''Sapphic pop''' is a term used to describe a particular subgenre of [[indie music]] and [[bedroom pop]]. The genre typically has female, often [[femme]], singer-songwriters and will often feature lyrical themes such as [[lesbian]] or [[queer]] love.

The name of the subgenre derives from [[Terminology of homosexuality#Sapphism|sapphism]].

[[Phoebe Bridgers]], [[Chappell Roan]], [[Muna (band)|Muna]], [[Tegan and Sara]], [[Clairo]], [[Girl in Red]], and [[King Princess]] have been cited as examples of the genre. 
Additionally, some songs have been described as "sapphic [[anthem]]s". For example, Muna and Phoebe Bridgers' song "Silk Chiffon", [[G Flip]] and [[mxmtoon]]'s song "Queen", and "[[Good Luck, Babe!]]" by Chappell Roan.

Meanwhile, artists such as Gemma Laurence have called their music "sapphic folk".
